title: Exposure of Sensitive Data Through Data Queries
overview: In situations where data should not be tied to individual users, but a large number of users should be able to make queries that scrub the identity of users, it may be possible to get information about a user -- e.g., by specifying search terms that are known to be unique to that user.
remediation: ::PHASE:Architecture and Design:STRATEGY::EFFECTIVENESS::DESCRIPTION:This is a complex topic. See the book Translucent Databases for a good discussion of best practices.::
